intro: Cirsium straussianum, commonly known as the Strasбур thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a robust root system that helps it survive in harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
